item.title: Report X-2023081791
item.description:
Report X-2023081791

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package found in unload during sort, leaking. Placed in tote. DescribePack: Package appears to be leaking due to bottom of container failing. This is possibly due to low quality outer packaging. Package also had no outer packaging, cap seals, or any bracing for the container or its contents. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Placed in tote.

item.title: Report E-2023090096
item.description:
Report E-2023090096

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-11T03:12:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-08
  • City: MUSKOGEE
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ACTION RESOURCES, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 1
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Truck transporting tank trailer load of Nitric Acid was in transit when the driver noticed product leaking from the front portion of the tank onto the rear portion of the truck. Driver pulled over to the shoulder of the road to investigate. Driver discovered a small leak coming from the tank. 911 was called for assistance. The fire department responded and deployed the hazmat team. The roadway was shut down as a precaution. Enviromental response and remediation crew was dispatched to the scene to perform the cleanup, remediation and load transfer onto another tanker. The load was successfully transferred to another tanker and transported to the destination. The cleanup and remediation of the small spill have been completed. The driver accidentally inhaled some nitric fumes before donning his PPE while investigating the problem. He was transported to hospital for treatment. Driver was treated and released. Upon a full inspection of the tank, it was determined that there were some pits in the barrel that caused the leak.

item.title: Report X-2023081254
item.description:
Report X-2023081254

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-11T03:12:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-16
  • City: BROKEN ARROW
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: package handlers saw the box was wet while unloading the trailer. they put the box in a hazmat tub and brought to qa. no damage to any other packages nor was the box leaking heavily. DescribePack: the lid/closure of the bottle was closed tightly, but there is still a gap for liquid to seep through. there is no hole, just a gap/crookedness to the lid. lid cannot be adjusted. this is a slow leak. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: package placed in damage tub, lid is messed up. placed in plastic hazmat bag.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was coming out of a trailer, when the trailer was opened the package was found spilling out. DescribePack: The cap on one of the plastic bottles completely came off, causing all contents to spill out. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The spill was immediately cleaned up, and placed in a hazardous material tote.

item.title: Report X-2023061351
item.description:
Report X-2023061351

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-16T00:32:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-23
  • City: OKLAHOMA CITY
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BNSF Railway Company
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: PROX 45816 was found leaking in the Oklahoma City Flynn Yard by an FRA Inspector. The Inspector found a minor drip from the Bottom Outlet Valve (BOV). EMI was dispatched, inspected PROX 45816 and determined the BOV cap was less than tool tight with residual product in the cap. The BNSF Contractor properly secured PROX 45816 to mitigate the release.
